title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) until a court case decision is reached.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, removing a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection or logging into an account. This change enforces the requirement for internet-connected account setup on all Windows 11 devices.
summary: Microsoft has updated the Windows 11 Insider Preview, eliminating a script that enabled users to install the operating system without an internet connection or a Microsoft account. Now, setting up Windows 11 devices requires an internet connection and account login.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway, ending on Monday, March 31st. The sale features numerous deals accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. A comprehensive roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, alongside a selection of budget-friendly alternatives.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale, ending on March 31st, offers over 100 deals on popular gear and budget-friendly alternatives. These deals are available without requiring an Amazon Prime membership.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. The transaction values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, with X carrying $12 billion in debt. This acquisition comes years after Musk originally purchased Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has bought the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, despite X having $12 billion in debt. This purchase follows Musk's initial acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion years earlier.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that won't boot. This feature, first announced last year, is designed to prevent incidents similar to the previous Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is currently testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool is intended for IT professionals to remotely fix Windows 11 devices that are unable to boot. The development of this feature was influenced by a desire to avoid problems like those experienced in the past with Crowdstrike.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to Google until next year, following the company's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. The original deadline was set for 2025, but an email sent to users announced the extension.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to transfer their accounts to Google accounts to next year. This decision comes after Google acquired Fitbit in early 2021. Initially, users were required to migrate by 2025, but a recent email to users has extended this deadline.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have developed an AI and machine learning-based model that improves the prediction of chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This new model utilizes both whole-slide tumor imaging data and gene expression analyses, achieving better performance than earlier models that relied on a single data type.
summary: Researchers have created an AI and machine learning model that more accurately predicts chemotherapy results for muscle-invasive bladder cancer by analyzing whole-slide tumor images and gene expression data together. This approach outperforms previous models based on single data types.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility

This breakthrough could lead to improved treatment methods for neurological and psychiatric conditions.
summary: Scientists have found that higher dopamine levels in the brain are linked to better cognitive flexibility, using PET imaging to show that increased dopamine production improves performance on difficult tasks. title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years

summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species revealed that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers significantly influence why certain plants thrive in specific areas but not in others.
